question.definition: What is the role and scope of the architecture team who support the CaaS platform? Group-wide? Or is this limited to certain domains?
Does the architecture team have Identity specialists that can work across all ?
To what degree is the architecture team embedded into the development & SDLC process?
Are there any specific roles defined in the team or/and company-wide dedicated to the architecture of the platform?
Does the team follow any process to measure and maintain the alignment of existing architecture with business strategy and goals?

Does the team collect any metrics around the architecture, development, evolution or (mis)alignment with solution design agreed with the Architecture team (or ARB)?
Example metrics: number of exceptions in Solution Architecture Reviews against RA, elapsed time to create Solution Designs for given requirements, regret spend.
Are you using any tools to design, apply or test architecture design and track architecture evolution?
How does the Cyber Security Architecture team engage with the overall design and implementation of business requirements that run on the system?

questions.definition: What is the role and scope of the architecture team who support the CaaS platform? Group-wide? Or is this limited to certain domains?
Does the architecture team have Identity specialists that can work across all ?
To what degree is the architecture team embedded into the development & SDLC process?
Are there any specific roles defined in the team or/and company-wide dedicated to the architecture of the platform?
Does the team follow any process to measure and maintain the alignment of existing architecture with business strategy and goals?

Does the team collect any metrics around the architecture, development, evolution or (mis)alignment with solution design agreed with the Architecture team (or ARB)?
Example metrics: number of exceptions in Solution Architecture Reviews against RA, elapsed time to create Solution Designs for given requirements, regret spend.
Are you using any tools to design, apply or test architecture design and track architecture evolution?
How does the Cyber Security Architecture team engage with the overall design and implementation of business requirements that run on the system?

topics.name: Organisational Architectural Alignment
topics.description: Alignment with the technology strategy, models and patterns as described within a reference architecture for the organisational capability.

question.definition: Are there any audit reports that are generated and reviewed on regular basis
What are the tools used to generate the audit report ?
What are the manual audit that you perform ?
What are the human review performed ? What are those events that you review
What are the critical events and how are they monitored ?
Are there any known vulnerabities in current auditing system
Are there logs captured for the platform ?
what are the different logs captured ?
Where are the logs captured
How long does it take for the logs to appear on the log capturing tool ?
Is the infra capacity monitored ? If so how ?
Are there dashboards created to monitor critical events ?

questions.definition: Are there any audit reports that are generated and reviewed on regular basis
What are the tools used to generate the audit report ?
What are the manual audit that you perform ?
What are the human review performed ? What are those events that you review
What are the critical events and how are they monitored ?
Are there any known vulnerabities in current auditing system
Are there logs captured for the platform ?
what are the different logs captured ?
Where are the logs captured
How long does it take for the logs to appear on the log capturing tool ?
Is the infra capacity monitored ? If so how ?
Are there dashboards created to monitor critical events ?

topics.name: Auditability
topics.description: The ability of a system to generate or obtain required artifacts to provide assurance that the system is safe, data integrity is maintained and the system is operating effectively. Compliance with all requirements including standards, policies, laws and service level agreements (SLA)

question.definition: How does your team and system define “availability”?
Are you tracking any availability metrics and data?

Are you using any tools or processes to test and monitor availability? Are these integrated with group-wide tooling and metrics? 
a.	Integration with third-parties — e.g., Verizon
b.	Cloud and On-Premise.
Do you have any availability goals derived from business SLAs/SLOs?
What are your SLAs and SLOs with respect to Availability?
What testing processes and environments do you have in place? Do your test environments topologically mirror production?
Do you regularly test different failure modes with controlled experiments?
What is your system’s ARC Tier, and how do you measure adherence to its requirements?
How does your team come to learn of availability issues?
What tools do you use to investigate availability issues?
What other systems (infrastructure, upstream, downstream or otherwise) affect your system’s availability? (e.g. DNS, networks)
Is the system architecture fully resilient, with redundancy and/or replication and failover at all necessary components (LB, Applications, DB, HSM)

questions.definition: How does your team and system define “availability”?
Are you tracking any availability metrics and data?

Are you using any tools or processes to test and monitor availability? Are these integrated with group-wide tooling and metrics? 
a.	Integration with third-parties — e.g., Verizon
b.	Cloud and On-Premise.
Do you have any availability goals derived from business SLAs/SLOs?
What are your SLAs and SLOs with respect to Availability?
What testing processes and environments do you have in place? Do your test environments topologically mirror production?
Do you regularly test different failure modes with controlled experiments?
What is your system’s ARC Tier, and how do you measure adherence to its requirements?
How does your team come to learn of availability issues?
What tools do you use to investigate availability issues?
What other systems (infrastructure, upstream, downstream or otherwise) affect your system’s availability? (e.g. DNS, networks)
Is the system architecture fully resilient, with redundancy and/or replication and failover at all necessary components (LB, Applications, DB, HSM)

topics.name: Availability
topics.description: The expected reliability of a computer system including software, hardware and networks

question.definition: Does your team follow CBA's group-wide change management standards?
Can you walk us through your usual change implementation process and steps from inception till production?

Please describe the type of changes make up your change pipeline (patching, release, code changes, configuration changes, etc.)
a.	For vendor-provided assets, please describe the process of how new versions of software are received from the vendor.
Are you following the same process for all components (e.g. HSM firmware updates and internally developed code)?

What type of testing do you perform? (e.g. performance, DR, functional, integration, unit)
a.	Is the level of testing performed varied per change? If so - how is the level of testing determined?
b.	How is this responsibility shared across teams?
How often do you perform changes per system? (Is there a scheduled or adhoc release cycle?)

Do you have a defined set of roles with respect to Change Management procedures?
a.	Do you have a project charter?
b.	How are responsibilities shared?
c.	Do Engineers have the ability to make changes in production?
d.	If so, how is access and privileges managed?

What are your release procedures?
a.	Are they standardised?
b.	Please provide a typical link or CM#
c.	How do you determine a change was successful?
d.	How do you determine that dependant systems are not impacted?

What are your rollback procedures?
a.	Are they standardised?
a.	How are these triggered?

How do you perform risk analysis and business impact analysis in the change review process?
a.	How many direct upstream and downstream systems do you have?
How do you determine that a change was successful?

Do you track to any KPIs, metrics, or stats regarding releases (number, frequency of release, duration, people involved, failure/success rate, and other metrics)?
a.	How long does each deployment take?
b.	How long is the associated outage?
c.	How many teams are involved?
Do you have any targeted and defined improvement goals or based on the above metrics?

questions.definition: Does your team follow CBA's group-wide change management standards?
Can you walk us through your usual change implementation process and steps from inception till production?

Please describe the type of changes make up your change pipeline (patching, release, code changes, configuration changes, etc.)
a.	For vendor-provided assets, please describe the process of how new versions of software are received from the vendor.
Are you following the same process for all components (e.g. HSM firmware updates and internally developed code)?

a.	Is the level of testing performed varied per change? If so - how is the level of testing determined?
b.	How is this responsibility shared across teams?
How often do you perform changes per system? (Is there a scheduled or adhoc release cycle?)

Do you have a defined set of roles with respect to Change Management procedures?
a.	Do you have a project charter?
b.	How are responsibilities shared?
c.	Do Engineers have the ability to make changes in production?
d.	If so, how is access and privileges managed?

b.	Please provide a typical link or CM#

a.	Are they standardised?
a.	How are these triggered?

a.	How many direct upstream and downstream systems do you have?
How do you determine that a change was successful?

Do you track to any KPIs, metrics, or stats regarding releases (number, frequency of release, duration, people involved, failure/success rate, and other metrics)?
a.	How long does each deployment take?
b.	How long is the associated outage?
c.	How many teams are involved?
Do you have any targeted and defined improvement goals or based on the above metrics?

topics.name: Change Management
topics.description: The alignment to a defined organisational process that enables an application to transition from a current state to a desired state. The maturity of tooling used to actuate change of state with minimal risk.

question.definition: Is there  classification of data within DaaS ?
Is there privacy policy documentation that you can refer us to
How are the classifications of data implemented within DaaS
How are the data classifications determined? Policy
What is the data retention policy for the platform
Is there evidence of data being discarded in line data retention policy
How are the data segregation to enable data privacy taking place
Is the access to the data being monitored and logged
What are the controls implemented to ensure the DaaS platform complies with data privacy policy
Where is the data being stored
is the production data replicated to a non prod environement
What is the worst case retreival time for an archived data
What protocol are in place to prevent the misuse and lost of data
What  protocols are in place to de-identify information when it is no longer required

questions.definition: Is there  classification of data within DaaS ?
Is there privacy policy documentation that you can refer us to
How are the classifications of data implemented within DaaS
How are the data classifications determined? Policy
What is the data retention policy for the platform
Is there evidence of data being discarded in line data retention policy
How are the data segregation to enable data privacy taking place
Is the access to the data being monitored and logged

is the production data replicated to a non prod environement
What is the worst case retreival time for an archived data
What protocol are in place to prevent the misuse and lost of data
What  protocols are in place to de-identify information when it is no longer required

topics.name: Privacy
topics.description: The set of concerns regarding the privacy required during the collection, aggregation and utilisation of data. This will include the use, disclosure, accuracy, security, categorisation and identity of data. The conformance to all legislation, policies, regulations and applicable codes of conduct.

question.definition:
What is the definition of "disaster" or “business continuity event” in your space?
a.	I.e. is it just 'whole site failure'? Reduced capacity scenarios?
What are the DR and availability 'primitives' that comprise your system? (e.g. Region – AZ – DC – Rack).
How often do you rehearse your DR strategy?
What steps do you perform in a DR situation? Are the steps documented in a group-wide tool (e.g. Rufus)
How long does it take to perform every step in the plan?
Is there any formalised segmentation performed on upstream systems/customers?

questions.definition:
What is the definition of "disaster" or “business continuity event” in your space?
a.	I.e. is it just 'whole site failure'? Reduced capacity scenarios?
What are the DR and availability 'primitives' that comprise your system? (e.g. Region – AZ – DC – Rack).
How often do you rehearse your DR strategy?
What steps do you perform in a DR situation? Are the steps documented in a group-wide tool (e.g. Rufus)
How long does it take to perform every step in the plan?
Is there any formalised segmentation performed on upstream systems/customers?

topics.name: Service Continuity
topics.description: The ability to restore services in the event of a disaster (e.g. loss of data centre) that destroys or interrupts service for some or all of the business's resources. A Business Continuity event, and the processes, procedures and specific actions taken in such event to ensure that service will be restored in a timely manner with no loss of data.

question.definition: What are the major P1/P2 incidents that happened over the last 6 months
What were the nature of the incidents / which systems have been impacted? Any general themes? (e.g. networking, hardware, software)
What are your monitoring and alerting tools / processes?
How are you accessing production? Are you using a jump-box, TPAM, one‐time password?
Do you have audits of all production activity?
Are you aware of all business and/or system specific SLAs/SLOs while fixing production issues?
Do you have any incident runbook and knowledge-base repositories to refer to in case of incident?
What are your on‐duty call process?
What are the communication channel and methods during an incident?
Do you have any specific approach to problem analysis during an incident?
Do you use any tools in particular to pinpoint the root cause of issues? (e.g. Splunk, AppDynamics…)
holding any Incident Retrospective (PIR, Post‐incident review) meeting? How frequent?
Are you rehearsing regularly the processes and resolution steps of past incidents?
Are you gathering any specific health metrics (volume, severity of incidents, number of escalations)?
Any additional advanced metrics such as MTTD, MTTR, number of escalations?
Are you reporting/reflecting on existing metrics to spot any trends/patterns?
Are you consistently determining the cost per previous incidents?
Is there any assurance protocol surrounding the close off of the Incident?

questions.definition: What are the major P1/P2 incidents that happened over the last 6 months
What were the nature of the incidents / which systems have been impacted? Any general themes? (e.g. networking, hardware, software)
What are your monitoring and alerting tools / processes?
How are you accessing production? Are you using a jump-box, TPAM, one‐time password?

Are you gathering any specific health metrics (volume, severity of incidents, number of escalations)?
Any additional advanced metrics such as MTTD, MTTR, number of escalations?
Are you reporting/reflecting on existing metrics to spot any trends/patterns?
Are you consistently determining the cost per previous incidents?
Is there any assurance protocol surrounding the close off of the Incident?

topics.name: Incident Management
topics.description: The tooling and processes enabling an appropriate response to incidents and the alignment with broader incident management frameworks throughout the organisation.

question.definition: Do you have any documentation or central knowledge repositories where the system modules details and their inter-relationships are defined? Are these documents regularly kept up to date (for instance, when implementing features or performing an upgrade)?
Who manages the changes to the API specifications (APIs) and their distribution? Who determines which API and standards will be supported? (e.g. OIDC, OAuth2.0)
Does your team maintain and follow standards, guidelines, templates, or playbooks for the development process from requirements to implementation? Are these standards defined group-wide?
Are your functional, non-functional and other requirements stored in a centralised manner?
How granular are the requirement and change specifications? E.g. do they typically get down to the module level?
How coupled are the modules in your space? Who is responsible for the documentation of the impact of change?
Are you using any data or metrics to track lead time, velocity, cycle time, code coverage, code analysis? Any other metrics such as failed deployment, testing results, escaped defects?

questions.definition: Do you have any documentation or central knowledge repositories where the system modules details and their inter-relationships are defined? Are these documents regularly kept up to date (for instance, when implementing features or performing an upgrade)?
Who manages the changes to the API specifications (APIs) and their distribution? Who determines which API and standards will be supported? (e.g. OIDC, OAuth2.0)
Does your team maintain and follow standards, guidelines, templates, or playbooks for the development process from requirements to implementation? Are these standards defined group-wide?
Are your functional, non-functional and other requirements stored in a centralised manner?
How granular are the requirement and change specifications? E.g. do they typically get down to the module level?
How coupled are the modules in your space? Who is responsible for the documentation of the impact of change?
Are you using any data or metrics to track lead time, velocity, cycle time, code coverage, code analysis? Any other metrics such as failed deployment, testing results, escaped defects?

topics.name: Maintainability
topics.description: The set of attributes that bear on the effort needed to make specified modifications to a system or service. The ease with which a system or component may be modified to correct faults, improve performance or adapt to a changed environment. The ease with which a system may be retained in, or restored to a state in which it performs its required functions.

question.definition: What is the retention rate of staff, particularly SMEs?
Are you conducting training? Is it internal or external? Is there a training budget / timesheet code allocated to training?
Are you grouping/investing/uplifting SME knowledge/skills across the organisation, including outside the immediate team?
Is there a succession plan defined and being followed?

questions.definition: What is the retention rate of staff, particularly SMEs?
Are you conducting training? Is it internal or external? Is there a training budget / timesheet code allocated to training?
Are you grouping/investing/uplifting SME knowledge/skills across the organisation, including outside the immediate team?
Is there a succession plan defined and being followed?

topics.name: Organisational Capability
topics.description: The organisation requires different skills and roles in order to perform effectively. The correct individuals and teams are organised in a way to achieve the optimum outcomes for the organisation.

question.definition: How is the performance testing performed on the system ?
What are the performance requirements on these platforms (metrics, SLA/SLO)?
Are there any Customer contractual or industry-wide agreements for Performance? If so, how are these requirements managed?

Which environments are used to run your performance testing (NFT)? Pre-PROD?
a.	How accurately can one extrapolate from these environments to predict production performance?
How granular are the performance requirements? Do the requirements consider underlying infrastructure? (e.g. HSM response times)?
Given the external connectivity for the end-to-end business processes for authorisation how are the differences in the performance of the external parties managed
How are you reporting performance statistics? Are you running any analysis or/and deriving improvements goals from these statistics?
Are you keeping tracked of any performance anomalies and performance related incidents?
How are performance bottlenecks surfaced?

questions.definition: How is the performance testing performed on the system ?
What are the performance requirements on these platforms (metrics, SLA/SLO)?
Are there any Customer contractual or industry-wide agreements for Performance? If so, how are these requirements managed?

Which environments are used to run your performance testing (NFT)? Pre-PROD?
a.	How accurately can one extrapolate from these environments to predict production performance?
How granular are the performance requirements? Do the requirements consider underlying infrastructure? (e.g. HSM response times)?
Given the external connectivity for the end-to-end business processes for authorisation how are the differences in the performance of the external parties managed
How are you reporting performance statistics? Are you running any analysis or/and deriving improvements goals from these statistics?
Are you keeping tracked of any performance anomalies and performance related incidents?
How are performance bottlenecks surfaced?

topics.name: Performance
topics.description: The degree to which a service aligns with mandated performance metrics, and the degree to which the performance and efficiency of the service is targeted, tracked and measured.

question.definition:
What are the primary type of assets developed on the team?
a.	That is - code and software development assets that are authored on your team. This includes management, scripting and deployment infrastructure.
b.	Please call out any major systems & Components (e.g. SSB, SS)

Tooling (in all cases - please provide links or entry points)
- a.	How do you manage your team's work-in-progress and track progress?
- b.	Source control?
- c.	Build tools and a CI/CD pipeline?
- d.	Deployment?
- e.	Knowledge management? (e.g. Confluence)
Do you have onboarding and developer guides? (If so - please provide links)

What are the different roles defined in the team (project manager, product owner, developer, Ops, etc.)?
a.	Do you have a project charter?
b.	If there are multiple companies involved, what is the split of responsibilities?
Are they any coding standards, best practices or processes adhered to by the team?
Do you perform any automated testing?

How representative is your test environment of production, with respect to:
a.	Capacity
b.	Interfacing systems
c.	Alerting
What are the metrics and statistics gathered helping the SDLC processes? (e.g. defect rates, velocity, test coverage, code quality)
Are there any KPIs tracked regularly around process improvement?

Is your adherence to a standard SDLC regularly audited?

a.	Are there any historic audit reports available for review?

a.	Capacity

c.	Alerting
What are the metrics and statistics gathered helping the SDLC processes? (e.g. defect rates, velocity, test coverage, code quality)
Are there any KPIs tracked regularly around process improvement?

Is your adherence to a standard SDLC regularly audited?

a.	Are there any historic audit reports available for review?

topics.name: SDLC Process
topics.description: The process used by the organisation to deliver software, including the design, development, testing and packaging of the overall solution to deliver software in a repeatable, methodical way to ensure completion within time and cost estimates.

question.definition: What are your primary objectives, guidelines and goals in regard to scalability? Are they aligned with the rest of the organisation (e.g ARC Tiers)?

How is the application/service architected to enable scalability? 
a.	Do you directly control your supporting infrastructure (hardware, servers, networking equipment)? Who supports it? Who provisions it?
Do you have any roles formally defined in your team to consider scalability requirements? Roles could be assigned to document, design, test and/or measure scalability over time

How are you testing scalability in SS, SSB, HSM and Cassandra? Does this testing include upstream and/or downstream systems or is it run in isolation?
a.	Note: this is distinct from performance testing. That is – how do you test your system's ability to respond to and cope with changes in demand. Both short-term (I.e. sudden spikes) and longer-term trends.
Are there any scalability features (e.g auto-scaling) across components that you can apply?
Are you utilising any tools, frameworks and libraries specifically for responding to scalability events (e.g. thresholds crossed)? (covering design, test and execution)
Do you have any metrics and reports collected in relation to scalability and capacity?
Are there any improvement goals defined around scalability, with respect to the above metrics?

questions.definition: What are your primary objectives, guidelines and goals in regard to scalability? Are they aligned with the rest of the organisation (e.g ARC Tiers)?

How is the application/service architected to enable scalability? 
a.	Do you directly control your supporting infrastructure (hardware, servers, networking equipment)? Who supports it? Who provisions it?
Do you have any roles formally defined in your team to consider scalability requirements? Roles could be assigned to document, design, test and/or measure scalability over time

How are you testing scalability in SS, SSB, HSM and Cassandra? Does this testing include upstream and/or downstream systems or is it run in isolation?
a.	Note: this is distinct from performance testing. That is – how do you test your system's ability to respond to and cope with changes in demand. Both short-term (I.e. sudden spikes) and longer-term trends.
Are there any scalability features (e.g auto-scaling) across components that you can apply?
Are you utilising any tools, frameworks and libraries specifically for responding to scalability events (e.g. thresholds crossed)? (covering design, test and execution)
Do you have any metrics and reports collected in relation to scalability and capacity?
Are there any improvement goals defined around scalability, with respect to the above metrics?

topics.name: Scalability
topics.description: The ability of a system to accommodate an increasing number of elements, process growing volumes of work gracefully and where capacity can be expanded.

question.definition: What are the specific roles and groups defined in the team and/or company that are relevant to the CaaS application?

Are there specific standards or governance frameworks that cover the team's requirements to perform vulnerability scanning, pen testing, and security compliance?
a.	Examples: Cyber Security Non-Negotiables
b.	Maintenance of a Vulnerability Management Programme
c.	Physical access to data centres (if applicable)
d.	Regular Testing
e.	Key ceremonies and register of key custodians

Are there any security standards applied by the team governing secure coding best practices, secure communication (encryption in-transit and at rest), authentication, authorisation, and centralised secrets management?

For cross-system network communications, how are these secured?
a.	Install and maintenance of firewall configuration
b.	Encrypt transmission of data across open public and/or private networks

How is data secured at rest? 
a.	Management of retention periods and quarterly removal where required.
How are the credentials for users and operators of relevant systems managed?

How are security issues and breaches surfaced?
a.	Is there any monitoring or recording to alert for suspicious activity?
b.	Track and monitor all access to network resources and data

Any guidelines and standards followed by the team around network, host or application security scanning?
a.	Develop and maintain secure systems and applications

Is the team collecting any metrics relevant to Security? Are these metrics collated and analysed separately by security experts and asset owners?
a.	Example: No. of unpatched servers over time
b.	Regularly test security systems and processes.

What tools and governance procedures enable you to track your security compliance or deviance?
a.	Example: Artefact scanning, static analysis, RiskInSite

How does the team use group-wide processes and practices governing such risk analysis, shared taxonomy, security rating assessment?
a.	Restrict access to data by business need to know
What security-related assets are mandated per release - e.g. when reviewing a change record?

a.	Restrict access to data by business need to know
What security-related assets are mandated per release - e.g. when reviewing a change record?

topics.name: Security
topics.description: The set of cyber security strategies that prevents unauthorised access to organisational assets including systems, hardware, networks and data. Maintaining the integrity and confidentiality of sensitive information. Preventing unauthorised access.

question.definition: Is there any testing frameworks or guidelines followed? If yes, what are they and how is the testing strategy designed to follow the framework?
Are there separate testing environments available for testing purposes (System Testing, System Integration Testing, UAT etc)? Can the test environment realistically simulate real workloads?
How is testing performed - Are most of the efforts manual or automated? Is there a defined Automation testing frameworks?
Is there segregation of duties between testers and developers in such a way that the development and testing is performed by different individuals?
Are the testing activities segregated for different purposes? For example - functional, integration, unit testing, user acceptance testing, performance, security, stress etc
Does the releases maintain a traceability matrix to ensure the testing coverage with respect to the requirements?
What types of non-functional testing is performed?
What tools are used to perform functional and non-functional testing?
How the testing evidence is documented and maintained?
How is the test suite defined?  Does it co-relate to the test coverage and ensure that all the requirements to test a component is covered?
How are the system logs set up?  Is it possible to list every web service call and see who made  it and which order it was processed?
How is scriptable message passing set up? Is the system set up in a way to be able to replay the script of those message transfers on demand?
Are there test servers created such as docker containers which are copies of server in production?
Are there mocks, stubs or fakes created for service virtualization to isolate part of  the system and  test it real time?

questions.definition: Is there any testing frameworks or guidelines followed? If yes, what are they and how is the testing strategy designed to follow the framework?
Are there separate testing environments available for testing purposes (System Testing, System Integration Testing, UAT etc)? Can the test environment realistically simulate real workloads?
How is testing performed - Are most of the efforts manual or automated? Is there a defined Automation testing frameworks?
Is there segregation of duties between testers and developers in such a way that the development and testing is performed by different individuals?
Are the testing activities segregated for different purposes? For example - functional, integration, unit testing, user acceptance testing, performance, security, stress etc
Does the releases maintain a traceability matrix to ensure the testing coverage with respect to the requirements?
What types of non-functional testing is performed?
What tools are used to perform functional and non-functional testing?
How the testing evidence is documented and maintained?
How is the test suite defined?  Does it co-relate to the test coverage and ensure that all the requirements to test a component is covered?
How are the system logs set up?  Is it possible to list every web service call and see who made  it and which order it was processed?
How is scriptable message passing set up? Is the system set up in a way to be able to replay the script of those message transfers on demand?
Are there test servers created such as docker containers which are copies of server in production?
Are there mocks, stubs or fakes created for service virtualization to isolate part of  the system and  test it real time?

topics.name: Testability
topics.description: The degree to which a software system or a unit thereof supports its own testing, including the repeatability, automation and the accurate and timely reporting of the results.

question.definition: Is there an agreement with the vendor for DaaS ? If so how many vendors ?
What sub agreement exists ?
Where does the contract sit? Is it with an Individual ?

What is the agreement with each vendor?
A) Is there a lockin period?
B) Any extensions to the existing contract?
How is a service built ? What is the techology used?
Could you please share the contract?
Is there areas in the contract that are lacking?
How is legal and procurement managed? Is it centralized?
How is dispute resolution managed in the contract
Does the contract mention SLA's and performance related requirement?
Does the contract define penalties? If so what are they ?
Is this standardised template or vendor provided template?
How are the contract SLAs managed? Any regular reviews done?
Are there any risks identified
Do client provide thought leadership actively?

topics.name: Vendor Agreements
topics.description: Contracts and agreements that govern how vendors and client operate with relation to the service or capability.
